long: Meaning: a "mass" of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized for war (an "army"); by implication, a "campaign", literally or figuratively (specifically, "hardship", "worship").  Usage: appointed time, ( ) army, ( ) battle, company, host, service, soldiers, waiting upon, war(-fare).  Source: or (feminine) "צְבָאָה"; from "H6633";
